alert.note: Alert for Mason; Wood (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...CREEKS STILL RUNNING HIGH AND SOME ROADS REMAIN CLOSED... Creeks and streams continue to run high, with some roads still closed across the area due to high water. Additional rainfall today, while not as heavy as that of yesterday, could lead to some continued high water issues across the area given the already saturated conditions. Never attempt to drive through a flooded roadway. Please continue to heed any road closures posted by local authorities. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous during and after heavy rain. Do not attempt to travel across flooded roads. Find alternate routes. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. It is especially hard to tell the depth of the water at night. It takes only a few inches of swiftly flowing water to carry vehicles away.
